DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: XAVIER, C. C.;Xavier, Csar C.;XAVIER, CESAR C.;XAVIER, CESAR

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia Eltrica pela Universidade Federal da Paraba (1992), Mestrado em Engenharia de Sistemas e Computao pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2005), Doutorado pela Universidade de So Paulo / Instituto de Pesquisas Energticas e Nucleares (2010) e Ps-Doutorado na Universit degli Studi Roma Tre - Itlia (2013).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor's at Engenharia Eltrica from Universidade Federal da Paraba (1992), Master's at Computer Science from Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2005), Doctorate at Nuclear Engineering from Universidade de So Paulo (2010), Po-Doc at University of Roma 3 - Italy (2013). It`s interested in: electon gun, finite element method, path equation and travelling-wave tube and parallel computing.

ENDERECO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO-EMPRESA: Centro Tecnolgico da Marinha em So Paulo

MESTRADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Visualizao de Terrenos baseado na construo de uma Bit-Interleaving QuadTree

DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Desenvolvimento ferramenta computacional para projeto de canhes de eltrons com grade e shadow-grid, PPM e coletores aplicados em vlvulas de micro-ondas de potncia e caracterizao experimental

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagao de Ondas, Antenas

PESQUISA-E-DESENVOLVIMENTO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Pesquisas Energticas e Nucleares

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Desenvolvimento de Vlvulas de Microondas de Potncia
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Desenvolver conceitos fundamentais a serem estabelecidos na implementao de uma ferramenta computacional para projeto de canhes eletrnicos com grade para vlvulas de microondas tipo TWT (Traveling-Wave Tube) e de um analisador de energia para caracterizao experimental do canh eletrnico projetado a partir da ferramenta. Em particular, para a ferramenta computacional, proposto um esquema de projeto de canhes baseado nos mtodos: Partcula na Clula e Mtodo de Elementos Finitos com o objetivo de modelar a anisotropia na superfcie de emisso, a distribuio de temperatura do catodo e as aberraes produzidas no feixe eletrnico pela grade de controle.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao Nacional de Desenvolvimento do Ensino Superior Particular

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Fundao Nacional de Desenvolvimento do Ensino Superior Particular

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de Abordagens de Engenharia de Software para Sistemas no Contexto de Engenharia Eltrica
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Para o aluno de Engenharia, as metodologias de elicitao de requisitos e especificao de interfaces homem-computador so nebulosas. Com a finalidade de integrar a Engenharia Eltrica e a Computao, este trabalho aborda os conceitos e metodologias de Engenharia de Software em dois estudos de casos. Tendo como principiais resultados a escolha de padres de elicitao de requisitos, modelagem de tarefas do software e modelagem dos usurios que vo interagir com o software de ambos os estudos de caso

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Particle Trajectory Code using the FEM approach: preliminary results
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Particle Trajectory Code using the FEM approach: preliminary results

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 17th International Conference on the Computation of Electromagnetic Fields

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We describe the numerical code based on Finite Element Method (FEM) developed to study the focusing proper- ties of eletrostatic lenses for non-relativistic electrons trajectories on a two-dimensional electron gun with cylindrical symetry. In order to apply the FEM, the Galerkin Weak Formulation was used. A Delaunay triangulation of the domain was built, and using FEM, the sparse system was solved for the scalar potential associated to the nodes. In order to solve the non-linear second order electron path differential equation, a fourth-order Runge- Kutta integrator is used.We show that absolute paths errors are below 1.5e-4%, even with a modest discretization of the total space domain.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We describe the numerical code based on Finite Element Method (FEM) developed to study the focusing proper- ties of eletrostatic lenses for non-relativistic electrons trajectories on a two-dimensional electron gun with cylindrical symetry. In order to apply the FEM, the Galerkin Weak Formulation was used. A Delaunay triangulation of the domain was built, and using FEM, the sparse system was solved for the scalar potential associated to the nodes. In order to solve the non-linear second order electron path differential equation, a fourth-order Runge- Kutta integrator is used.We show that absolute paths errors are below 1.5e-4%, even with a modest discretization of the total space domain.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Design of a gridded electron gun using the particle path and the FEM approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Design of a gridded electron gun using the particle path and the FEM approach

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract
The XMGUN was used to design a 30kV, 4.6A and 0.88μPerv axis-symmetric high power electron gun, with grid and shadow grid, working under the space charge limited flow to be used in a TWT. The XMGUN uses the particle path, instead of the motion equation, to perform the macroparticles ray tracing and the FEM approach. It was observed a current increase and a decrease of the normalized transverse velocity when the control grid voltage was varied from 400V to 600V.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Particle-Path FEM Aprroach Used on Electron Gun, Magnetic Focusing and Collector TWT Design
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Particle-Path FEM Aprroach Used on Electron Gun, Magnetic Focusing and Collector TWT Design

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: By using a particle-path approach code, instead of the motion equation, this paper reports on the electron-beam propagation behavior in: an electron gun; a drift tube; and a collector to be used on traveling-wave tubes (TWT) design. In the electron gun with control grid and shadow-grid, it is investigated the influence of the grid voltage on the beam-waist size, the distance to the cathode, and the transverse velocity. In the drift tube, using a periodic permanent magnet (PPM) focusing structure, considering a Brillouin flow, the beam behavior is analyzed keeping constant the electric current. Finally, using one single electron collector, the beam behavior is also reported.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: By using a particle-path approach code, instead of the motion equation, this paper reports on the electron-beam propagation behavior in: an electron gun; a drift tube; and a collector to be used on traveling-wave tubes (TWT) design. In the electron gun with control grid and shadow-grid, it is investigated the influence of the grid voltage on the beam-waist size, the distance to the cathode, and the transverse velocity. In the drift tube, using a periodic permanent magnet (PPM) focusing structure, considering a Brillouin flow, the beam behavior is analyzed keeping constant the electric current. Finally, using one single electron collector, the beam behavior is also reported.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: TWT Beam Transport Design Tools Based on FEM and the Particle Path Approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: TWT Beam Transport Design Tools Based on FEM and the Particle Path Approach

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 18th International Conference on the Computation of Electromagnetic Fields

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This work reports some results from the 2D axisymmetric codes, XMGUN and XMAGUN, based on the Finite Element Method (FEM) and the particle path equation in the design of electron guns, Periodic Permanent Magnets (PPM) and collectors to be used on Traveling-Wave Tubes (TWTs). The XMGUN code was used to model the particle trajectories in an electron gun, a PPM structure and a collector. Using XMGUN a 30 kV electron gun, 4.9 A and 0.94 μPerv, working under the space charged condition, with grids and control grids and a single stage collector with secondary emission were designed. The radial and longitudinal magnetic fields, in the drift tube, due to a PPM structure, were obtained using the XMAGUN code. These fields are mapped into the first-order finite elements structure data, and XMGUN will be used to determine the particles path.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract This work reports some results from the 2D axisymmetric codes, XMGUN and XMAGUN, based on the Finite Element Method (FEM) and the particle path equation in the design of electron guns, Periodic Permanent Magnets (PPM) and collectors to be used on Traveling-Wave Tubes (TWTs). The XMGUN code was used to model the particle trajectories in an electron gun, a PPM structure and a collector. Using XMGUN a 30 kV electron gun, 4.9 A and 0.94 μPerv, working under the space charged condition, with grids and control grids and a single stage collector with secondary emission were designed. The radial and longitudinal magnetic fields, in the drift tube, due to a PPM structure, were obtained using the XMAGUN code. These fields are mapped into the first-order finite elements structure data, and XMGUN will be used to determine the particles path.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: XMAGUN: An iron pole piece PPM design and analysis FEM code
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: XMAGUN: An iron pole piece PPM design and analysis FEM code

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2011 IEEE International Vacuum Electronics Conference IVEC-2011

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An analysis of an iron pole piece PPM code based on the Finite Element Method (FEM) for travelingwave tube (TWT) design is presented. The XMAGUN was developed to determine the axial and radial magnetic fields inside such devices. During simulations, the outer pole piece radius was varied and, as a result, it was obtained a growth of the axial peak magnetic field value when the outer pole piece radius was reduced. This behavior was observed when the outer pole piece radius ranged 8.7 mm - 6.3 mm. The axial magnetic field peaks obtained by the XMAGUN were compared with the analytically calculated and the FEM commercial code ANSYS and good agreement was observed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: An analysis of an iron pole piece PPM code based on the Finite Element Method (FEM) for travelingwave tube (TWT) design is presented. The XMAGUN was developed to determine the axial and radial magnetic fields inside such devices. During simulations, the outer pole piece radius was varied and, as a result, it was obtained a growth of the axial peak magnetic field value when the outer pole piece radius was reduced. This behavior was observed when the outer pole piece radius ranged 8.7 mm - 6.3 mm. The axial magnetic field peaks obtained by the XMAGUN were compared with the analytically calculated and the FEM commercial code ANSYS and good agreement was observed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: An electron gun design for a C-band TWT
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: An Electron Gun Design for a C-Band TWT

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2011 SBMO/IEEE MTTS International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference (IMOC)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2011 SBMO/IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference (IMOC 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper a design procedure of a 9kV, 0.45A, with a beam waist of 1.5 mm electron gun, without control grid, operating under the space-charge limited condition, to be used in a C-Band Traveling-Wave Tube (TWT), is presented. During the design, three electron gun geometric parameters were varied, namely: the cathode-anode distance, the anode height and the focusing electrode angle, in order to study the electron beam behavior. To cut the electron beam current, a negative voltage was applied on the focusing electrode. It was verified that a 2.5kV biasing negative voltage in the focusing electrode, decreased the electric current from 0.45 A to 1.2mA. All gun simulations were done using the EGUN code.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper a design procedure of a 9kV, 0.45A, with a beam waist of 1.5 mm electron gun, without control grid, operating under the space-charge limited condition, to be used in a C-Band Traveling-Wave Tube (TWT), is presented. During the design, three electron gun geometric parameters were varied, namely: the cathode-anode distance, the anode height and the focusing electrode angle, in order to study the electron beam behavior. To cut the electron beam current, a negative voltage was applied on the focusing electrode. It was verified that a 2.5kV biasing negative voltage in the focusing electrode, decreased the electric current from 0.45 A to 1.2mA. All gun simulations were done using the EGUN code.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: To evaluate computational time performance the same geometry of a 1kV axis-symmetric gridless electron gun, working under the space charge-limited condition, was simulated using three computational tools: EGUN2, XMGUN and CST. It was observed, between the three codes, good electric current agreement but the 2.5D codes presented better time responsive
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: To evaluate computational time performance the same geometry of a 1kV axis-symmetric gridless electron gun, working under the space charge-limited condition, was simulated using three computational tools: EGUN2, XMGUN and CST. It was observed, between the three codes, good electric current agreement but the 2.5D codes presented better time responsive

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: The accelerated multi-stage depressed collector code COLLGUN using CUDA

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagao de Ondas, Antenas

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: COLLGUN, designed to simulate multistage depressed collectors was optimized by using parallel computing. This work reports the speedups observed on a parallel implementation of the COLLGUN code using CUDA. It was parallelized the solver of the sparse system for the electric scalar potential using the Incomplete Cholesky Conjugate Gradient Method (a) and the determination of the electric field inside each tetrahedron of the mesh (b) and speedups over 3X and 5X was respectively observed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: COLLGUN, designed to simulate multistage depressed collectors was optimized by using parallel computing. This work reports the speedups observed on a parallel implementation of the COLLGUN code using CUDA. It was parallelized the solver of the sparse system for the electric scalar potential using the Incomplete Cholesky Conjugate Gradient Method (a) and the determination of the electric field inside each tetrahedron of the mesh (b) and speedups over 3X and 5X was respectively observed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A study of a PPM focusing system for a C-band power TWT
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Study of a PPM Focusing System for a C-Band Power TWT

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2011 SBMO/IEEE MTTS International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference (IMOC)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2011 SBMO/IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference (IMOC 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper a methodology to determine the suitable magnetic focusing properties that minimizes the electron beam ripple, propagating in a drift region, is presented. The methodology is applied in a typical C-band, power travelingwave tube (TWT) which needs a 9.0 keV and 0.4 A electron beam with 0.8 mm of beam waist for a right operation. Using numerical simulation tools the beam behavior was investigated in the drift region along of periodic permanent magnet (PPM) without pole pieces and with 10 magnets. Best results were found with magnets with a length of 3.1 mm, an inner radius of 3.4mm, an outer radius of 6.35 mm, and a peak magnetic density flux intensity of 605 mT. In all cases studied the separation between adjacent magnets was set in 1.1 mm. By the using of the present methodology, no hollows in the electron beam were observed and a beam ripple of 1.99% was obtained. Some additional design details are also discussed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper a methodology to determine the suitable magnetic focusing properties that minimizes the electron beam ripple, propagating in a drift region, is presented. The methodology is applied in a typical C-band, power travelingwave tube (TWT) which needs a 9.0 keV and 0.4 A electron beam with 0.8 mm of beam waist for a right operation. Using numerical simulation tools the beam behavior was investigated in the drift region along of periodic permanent magnet (PPM) without pole pieces and with 10 magnets. Best results were found with magnets with a length of 3.1 mm, an inner radius of 3.4mm, an outer radius of 6.35 mm, and a peak magnetic density flux intensity of 605 mT. In all cases studied the separation between adjacent magnets was set in 1.1 mm. By the using of the present methodology, no hollows in the electron beam were observed and a beam ripple of 1.99% was obtained. Some additional design details are also discussed.

Abstract
This work reports some initial results of a 2-D electron gun design code (XMGUN) based on the finite-element method (FEM). Using the Galerkin weak formulation, the nodal analysis, and the first-order elements, the Poisson equation was solved for the electron gun electrostatic potential. The nonrelativistic particle paths were numerically calculated by a fourth-order Runge-Kutta method. An iterative scheme was repeated until the electron paths convergence was achieved under full space-charge limited condition. In order to validate the algorithm, the focusing properties of a 2-D Pierce electron gun with planar symmetry were studied. The quality of the beam was evaluated based on the particle's final position, the transit time, and the particle energy evaluations. Using these three parameters, a good agreement was found between the theoretical and calculated results. Absolute current density errors of less than 1% were found, even with a coarse discretization of the domain. The XMGUN tool was used to design a 30-kV, 7.1-A, and 1.37-μPerv axis-symmetric high-power electron gun for use in vacuum microwave devices. The figure of merit used as reference to measure the quality of the electron beam was the normalized transverse velocity.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract?By using a particle-path approach code, instead of the motion equation, this paper reports on the electron-beam propagation behavior in: an electron gun; a drift tube; and a collector to be used on traveling-wave tubes (TWT) design. In the electron gun with control grid and shadow-grid, it is investigated the influence of the grid voltage on the beam-waist size, the distance to the cathode, and the transverse velocity. In the drift tube, using a periodic permanent magnet (PPM) focusing structure, considering a Brillouin flow, the beam behavior is analyzed keeping constant the electric current. Finally, using a one stage electron collector, the beam behavior is also reported.

The XMAGUN was developed to determine the axial and radial magnetic fields inside such devices. During simulations, the outer pole piece radius was varied and, as a result, it was obtained a growth of the axial peak magnetic field value when the outer pole piece radius was reduced. This behavior was observed when the outer pole piece radius ranged 8.7 mm - 6.3 mm. The axial magnetic field peaks obtained by the XMAGUN were compared with the analytically calculated and the FEM commercial code ANSYS and good agreement was observed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de Ferramenta Computacional para Soluo de Sistemas Lineares Esparsos

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-INSTITUICAO: Centro Tecnolgico da Marinha Em Sao Paulo
DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagao de Ondas, Antenas

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, cientficas e tcnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O objetivo deste trabalho desenvolver um programa, utilizando o processamento paralelo, para a resoluo de sistemas lineares esparsos baseado nos mtodos do gradiente conjugado e de decomposio LU, os quais, aps validao, sero integrados aos cdigos XMGUN e XMAGUN bem como realizar experimentalmente medidas de parmetros relevantes no projeto de canhes de eltrons e PPM.
Desenvolvimento de software para soluo de sistemas lineares esparsos utilizando o Mtodo do Gradiente Conjugado e a capacidade de processamento das placas grficas da NVIDIA via CUDA.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Simulao Computacional e Caracterizao Experimenta de Canhes de EltronsS PERIDICOS DE MS PERMANENTES UTILIZADOS EM VLVULAS DE MICRO-ONDAS DO TIPO TWT
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: SIMULAO COMPUTACIONAL E CARACTERIZAO EXPERIMENTAL DE CANHES DE ELTRONS E ARRANJOS PERIDICOS DE MS PERMANENTES UTILIZADOS EM VLVULAS DE MICRO-ONDAS DO TIPO TWT

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O objetivo deste trabalho capacitar pessoal em projeto e caracterizao experimental de canhes de eltrons e estruturas peridicas de ms permanentes utilizadas em vlvulas de micro-ondas do tipo TWT.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: O objetivo deste trabalho capacitar pessoal em projeto e caracterizao experimental de canhes de eltrons e estruturas peridicas de ms permanentes utilizadas em vlvulas de micro-ondas do tipo TWT.
